summary:
Life has to be fun.

I am raised in a culture of "There is always a way to improve" and "If there is no news, then consider it good news.” I have heared people say it. At first, I thought these were good sayings to live by. 
Eventually, I had no idea what 'being good enough' really meant. My programming teachers said that my coding skills were not good enough. I believed them. I got motivated by the people who gave me bad energy. And this is the worst kind of motivation you can give to future generations. Results? Developing insecurities, imposter syndrome and never have joy in whatever I was doing.

I reïnvented myself. I found the love of my live (honestly, she found me), became a father of a beautiful son and found a home in Almere, The Netherlands. They are the main motivations for me to keep going. Work and career has more meaning than ever. And I feel good about it. I enjoy life and have much more fun in my work. I am keen to learn new technologies, skills and I started to love doing what I am doing in IT.

"If there is no news, then consider it good news?".. That is not motivating. However, I learned to celebrate achievements. Small and big. And now I get motivated in the right way, instead of being not getting motivated at all

"There is always a way to improve?" Every painting, song, photograph, design or solution will always have flaws. But at some point it is good enough. It's flaws is what makes every production perfect in it's own way! Including people...

Life has to be fun. Cheers and enjoy :)

projects.title: Software & Workflow Integration at Effectory & Customeyes
projects.description:
Effectory & Customeyes are employee satisfaction research companies.

In 2013, the two companies decided to work together. Effectory is specialised at quantitative research, while Customeyes uses the qualitative research method. 

As a group of graduate students, we had to find out which software could be used by Effectory and Customeyes, in order to standardise their work processes. We contacted vendors within the Netherlands and vendors abroad. We attended workshops, seminars and webinars and tested out demo versions of the software. We presented and demonstrated the best possible solution to our clients and teacher.

projects.title: IVCF City Marketing - DUWO
projects.description:
DUWO is a Dutch company, which is involved in the Dutch studenthousing industry. They have facilities in Amsterdam, Delft and other major Dutch cities where students go to their colleges.

DUWO was our client during this project. Our goal was to setup an effective marketing campaign and strategy for DUWO. To reach this goal, surveys were held among the students who have or had the ambition to go to college in the Netherlands.

The project team was multi-disciplinairy. The team existed out of Spanish, Catalan, Belgian and Dutch students. The Catalan, Spanish and Belgian students were studying at the Business University of Barcelona. The Dutch (which includes me) study/studied at the University of Amsterdam of Applied Sciences. The Spanish/Catalan/Belgian group were doing most of the research, while the Dutch group were accountable for setting up the Marketing Campain and facilitating the communication channels. 

The following movie is one of the project results;
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=y35WCAr2ptg

projects.title: Internship assignement: Set up an IT Governance Library for the local Dutch government Lelystad
projects.description:
The IT department of The local Dutch government of Lelystad, offered me the assignment in which I had to investigate the possibilities of communicating the IT governance contents through digital media.

During the 5-6 months, I investigated the current bottlenecks, according to the root-cause-analysis (RCA) standards. The bottlenecks were summarized, possible-solutions were set up and prioritized by the MoSCoW method. 

For the project I had to setup a technical and functional report/design for the development of the new application. 

The result of the project was a working prototype of the Information Library. This was presented by me to the stakeholders.

profile_positions.description:
I am working for the KVK / Chamber of Commerce as a Application Specialist. I work closely with scrum masters, product owners, front-, backend developers and quality assurance / testing specialist. 

While the DevOps teams focus on developing applications in Next.JS, dotNet and such, I keep track of technical debt and guide the DevOps teams through IT processes such as incident-, problem-, asset and changemanagement. I receive technical debts issues through ITSM tooling such as TOPdesk and translate these to user stories. 

My day to day activities;
- Assist the product owner in filling the backlog with users story's,
- Guide the DevOps teams at working accordingly the IT processes, such as incident-, problem-, asset and changemanagement,
- Server platform engineering,
- Agile Scrum activities such as refinements, sprintplanning, sprintreviews(presenting and preparing), retrospectives and such,
- Mobile app maintenance in Xamarin,
- Functional testing,
- Changemanagement proces coördination,
- Configure OTAP deployment platforms in Octopus,
- Set up Kibana dashboards for system/application logging,
- Promote the DevOps culture to enhance collaboration between Dev and Ops teams.
profile_positions.title: Application Specialist
Functioneel- Technisch applicatiebeheer bij Yacht Utrecht

profile_positions.description:
In the proces support role, I have used my experience as Business Information Administrator and knowledge about IT and underlying technology, to prioritise and rearrange the scope of the department "Bureau Inschrijving".

I have introduced an adaptation of Agile Scrum and ITSM to the department, supported by tools such as Microsoft Planner, Office365 apps, Teams and Topdesk. The purpose of the tools and working methodology was to guide the organisation in restructuring the workload and to give the management insights on the tasks and activities.

By implementing and the usage of tools the management became able to generate performance metrics and team performance monitoring functionalities, enabling them to substantiate their plans and decisions towards the operation.

My main task was to provide information and solutions, regarding to the education platform Eduarte to the business administrators, who worked for the education organisations.
